document.heading: District of Columbia Employees Child Care Facilities Act of 1986

history.narrative: Law 6-169, the “District of Columbia Employees Child Care Facilities Act of 1986,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-429, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 23, 1986, and October 7, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 30, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-218 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
